derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin erectio(n-), from erigere 'set up' (see erect)

entry.def: If a man has an erection, his penis is stiff, swollen, and sticking up because he is sexually aroused.
The erection of something is the act of building it or placing it in an upright position.

example.ex: ...the erection of temporary fencing to protect hedges under repair.
example.tran: 为保护正在养护的树篱而竖起的临时围栏

means.word_mean: 2. a structure that has been erected
3. the act of building or putting up

stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+direct直接的→adj.间接的, 迂回的
di离开+rect正,直→直接离开→径直的→指向，针对→管理，指导
direct直接的+ly表副词→adv.直接地, 立即
correct[v.改正,纠正]+itude状态→纠正后的状态
correct[v.改正,纠正]+ive表名词→n.矫正物, 中和物
